snippet: The United Network for Organ Sharing will require that volunteers be informed about risks, screened for medical and psychological suitability and tracked for future health problems.
abstract: Nation's transplant regulator United Network for Organ Sharing moves to require hospitals to thoroughly inform living kidney donors of risks they face, fully evaluate their medical and psychological suitability, and then track their health for two years after donation.
lead_paragraph: The United Network for Organ Sharing will require that volunteers be informed about risks, screened for medical and psychological suitability and tracked for future health problems.

headline.main: Hospitals Ordered to Do More to Protect Kidney Donors
headline.print_headline: Hospitals Ordered to Do More to Protect Kidney Donors
